title: setting an array element with a sequence when running force_plot
body:
Hi, I'm trying to apply shap to some training output from XGBoost.

Currently even I do simplest test like:

```
shap.force_plot(mean, shap_values = np.array([1,2,3]), matplotlib=True)
```

It throws some error like:
```
setting an array element with a sequence
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.4/dist-packages/shap/plots/force.py", line 104, in force_plot
    return visualize(e, plot_cmap, matplotlib, figsize=figsize, show=show, text_rotation=text_rotation)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.4/dist-packages/shap/plots/force.py", line 241, in visualize
    return AdditiveForceVisualizer(e, plot_cmap=plot_cmap).matplotlib(figsize=figsize, show=show, text_rotation=text_rotation)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.4/dist-packages/shap/plots/force.py", line 337, in matplotlib
    fig = draw_additive_plot(self.data, figsize=figsize, show=show, text_rotation=text_rotation)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.4/dist-packages/shap/plots/force_matplotlib.py", line 340, in draw_additive_plot
    neg_features, total_neg, pos_features, total_pos = format_data(data)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.4/dist-packages/shap/plots/force_matplotlib.py", line 241, in format_data
    i[0] = convert_func(pos_val)
ValueError: setting an array element with a sequence
```

Any idea what is wrong? Thanks for help.
